This kiosk was designed by a team of four Computer Science students from the University of Puget Sound: Ayse Hunt, Kayla Ramos, Marwan Johnstone, and Nick Bigger. The idea for this project stemmed from research that Ayse completed as part of her undergraduate thesis studying the use of educational technology in art museums. This work suggests the potential of digital tools to provide uniquely flexible and self-directed learning experiences for museum visitors. 
 
 Ayse pitched the idea of creating an interactive kiosk to feature video content to the rest of the team in November 2018. From there, the team decided to build an application that would showcase a particular piece of art, including biographical information about the artist and video of the piece's creation. 
 
 This project was made possible with help of Rebecca Engelhardt, Katie Buckingham, and Professor Adam Smith. In addition we'd like to thank [insert donor name here] for helping fund the purchase of this tablet.
